verses.roman:
'tīrtha-yātrāya pitāra saṅge chila bahu dhana
dhana dekhi ei duṣṭera laite haila mana

synonyms: tīrtha-yātrāya—when touring the holy places; pitāra—my father; saṅge—with; chila—there was; bahu—much; dhana—money; dhana—money; dekhi—seeing; ei—this; duṣṭera—of the rogue; laite—to take; haila—it was; mana—the intention.
translation: "While touring various holy places of pilgrimage, my father carried much money. Seeing the money, this rogue decided to take it away.
